comments:
Description:
Total function in text doesn't work.

Steps to reproduce:
1. New data source and dataset
2. Insert a text item, bind it with dataset, add a binding column
3. Input sth like <value-of>Total.min(row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"],NULL,0)</VALUE-OF>
4. Preview

Result:
Error0 : Error.ScriptEvaluationError ( 1 time(s) )

(<inline>#1) at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.constructError(ScriptRuntime.java:3240) at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.constructError(ScriptRuntime.java:3230) at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.notFoundError(ScriptRuntime.java:3303) at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.name(ScriptRuntime.java:1566) at org.mozilla.javascript.gen.c120._c0(<inline>:1) at org.mozilla.javascript.gen.c120.call(<inline>) at org.mozilla.javascript.ContextFactory.doTopCall(ContextFactory.java:304) at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.doTopCall(ScriptRuntime.java:2769)

It's not a bug.
First you should new a binding to the total fuction, and then use it.

Like this:
  new a binding like:
    totalUsed   any   Total.min(row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"],null,0)
  Input <value-of>row["totalUsed"]</VALUE-OF>

That will be ok. 

By the way, the "NULL" should be changed to "null" in this bug.
Engine will process the expression by creating new data binding. Not need the user to do it.
Same issue exists in dynamic text

traces.message: There are errors evaluating script "Total.min(row["New Column"],null,0)".
